thread.title: Defense keys Coal City football win over Streator
thread.title_full: Defense keys Coal City football win over Streator

title: Defense keys Coal City football win over Streator
text:
Defense keys Coal City football win over Streator Published: Friday, Oct. 2, 2015 11:40 p.m. CDT By MARK JOHNSON - Shaw Media Correspondent 
STREATOR â€“ Five interceptions by its defense and a combined five touchdowns by its two primary running backs keyed Coal City to a 41-12 Interstate Eight Conference Large football defeat of Streator on Friday night. Related Links Defense keys Coal City football win over Streator 
Quarterback Nick Micetich rolled out and took off for an eight-yard touchdown run that broke a scoreless tie more than halfway through the second quarter. The Coalers needed all of two plays to score again after forcing a Streator punt, as Nick Hayden broke off a 27-yard touchdown run. 
Streator scored late in the half to return it to a one-possession game, but a Hayden 17-yard carry to the end zone late in the third quarter started the transformation of the game into a rout. A Danny Kroeger interception on the first play of the fourth quarter led to a Joe Starkey 3-yard touchdown run, and a Brad Littleton pick was followed by another Hayden score from one yard out. Starkey followed a long Bulldog touchdown run with yet another score as time wound down.
